page.title: 20HAWARDEN CASTLE
page.content: The Parliamentary leader Sir William Brereton reported the event in the house of Commons. This was not the castle's only involvement in the Civil war.The Royalists at once tried to take the castle back they found the garrison badly prepared and took the commander prisoner in the village of Hawarden, however the garrison that was left in the castle refused to surrender.The Royalists laid seige and the castle eveentually fell after twelve days.A year passed before the Parliamentary forces mounted an attack on Chester and Hawarden. The seige lasted for a year before the castle surrendered. In 1647 the castle was destroyed by the Parliamentary forces.
